info.name: Exam Timetable System
info.description:
Complete API collection for managing exam terms and timetables. 

## Workflow:
1. Create exam term with multiple classes
2. View classes in the term
3. Create individual timetable for each class
4. View, update, publish/unpublish timetables

## Important Notes:
- Each timetable is for ONE class only
- Classes must be part of the exam term
- Duplicate timetables for same class in same term are prevented
- All GET endpoints auto-enrich data with names

item.name: 1. Exam Terms

request.description:
**Step 1: Create Exam Term**

Create a new exam term with multiple classes that will participate.

**Required Fields:**
- `name`: Term name (e.g., "Mid Term 2025", "Final Term 2025")
- `class_ids`: Array of class IDs that will have exams
- `start_date`: Term start date (ISO 8601 format)
- `end_date`: Term end date (ISO 8601 format)
- `meta_data`: Additional information

**Validations:**
✓ All classes must exist
✓ Classes must belong to the campus
✓ Start date must be before end date

**Response:**
Returns created exam term with enriched class names:
```json
{
  "id": "term123",
  "name": "Mid Term 2025",
  "class_ids": ["class1", "class2"],
  "classes": [
    {"id": "class1", "name": "Class 7A"},
    {"id": "class2", "name": "Class 7B"}
  ],
  "start_date": "2025-03-15T00:00:00Z",
  "end_date": "2025-03-25T00:00:00Z",
  "is_active": true,
  "is_deleted": false
}
```

Get all active exam terms for the campus.

**Filters Applied:**
- Only active terms (is_deleted = false)
- Sorted by updated_at DESC

**Response Enhancement:**
- Includes enriched class names
- Each class shows as {id, name}

**Use Case:**
Display list of all exam terms in the UI (like the card view showing "Mid Term 2025", "Final Term 2025", etc.)

**Step 2: Get Exam Term Details**

Retrieve a specific exam term with all its classes.

**Response:**
Returns term with enriched data:
- Class names populated
- All term details

**Use Case:**
When user clicks on a term card, fetch details to show the list of classes that need timetables.

Update an existing exam term.

**Optional Fields:**
- All fields are optional
- Only provided fields will be updated

**Validations:**
- If updating class_ids, validates all classes exist and belong to campus

**Note:**
Updating class_ids may affect existing timetables. Ensure timetables are updated accordingly.

Soft delete an exam term.

**Behavior:**
- Sets is_deleted = true
- Term won't appear in GET requests
- Data is preserved for audit purposes

**Warning:**
Consider impact on related timetables before deleting.

item.description: Exam term management endpoints. Terms define which classes will participate in a set of exams.

item.name: 2. Exam Timetables

request.description:
**Step 3: Create Timetable for a Specific Class**

Create exam timetable for ONE class only.

**Required Fields:**
- `exam_term_id`: ID of the exam term
- `exam_name`: Name of the examination
- `class_id`: Single class ID (NOT an array)
- `start_date`: Timetable start date
- `end_date`: Timetable end date
- `subjects`: Array of subject schedules

**Subject Object:**
- `subject_id`: Subject identifier (required)
- `exam_date`: Date of exam (required)
- `start_time`: Format "HH:MM" (required)
- `end_time`: Format "HH:MM" (required)
- `room`: Exam room (optional)
- `invigilator_ids`: Array of teacher IDs (optional)

**Validations:**
✓ Exam term must exist
✓ Class must be part of the exam term
✓ Class must belong to campus
✓ No duplicate timetable for same class in same term
✓ All subjects must exist
✓ No schedule conflicts for the class

**Response:**
Returns created timetable with enriched data:
- Subject names, codes, credits
- Class name
- Invigilator names

**Important:**
Repeat this call for EACH class in the term to create individual timetables.

**Example Workflow:**
1. Create timetable for Class 7A
2. Create timetable for Class 7B
3. Create timetable for Class 7C

Each class gets its own customized schedule.

Get all exam timetables for the campus (Admin only).

**Filters Applied:**
- Only active timetables (is_deleted = false)
- All statuses (draft and published)

**Response Enhancement:**
Each timetable includes:
- Enriched subject details (name, code, credits)
- Class names
- Exam term details
- Invigilator names

**Use Case:**
Admin dashboard showing all timetables across all terms and classes.

**Step 4: Get Timetable for Review**

Retrieve a specific exam timetable with all enriched data.

**Response:**
Fully enriched timetable with:
- Subject details (name: "Mathematics", code: "MAT101", credits: 4)
- Class name (e.g., "Class 7A")
- Exam term information
- Invigilator names (e.g., "John Doe", "Jane Smith")
- Complete schedule with dates and times

**Use Case:**
Display timetable details for review before publishing or for viewing published timetables.

Get all timetables for a specific exam term.

**Returns:**
Array of timetables, each for a different class within the term.

**Example Response Structure:**
```json
[
  {
    "id": "tt1",
    "class_ids": ["class7a"],
    "classes": [{"id": "class7a", "name": "Class 7A"}],
    "subjects": [...]
  },
  {
    "id": "tt2",
    "class_ids": ["class7b"],
    "classes": [{"id": "class7b", "name": "Class 7B"}],
    "subjects": [...]
  }
]
```

**Use Case:**
When user clicks on "Mid Term 2025", show all class timetables created for that term (Class 2 - Section A, Class 4 - Section B, etc.)

Get all published timetables for a specific class.

**Access:**
- Public endpoint
- Students and parents can access
- Returns only published timetables

**Use Case:**
Student/parent view to see all exam schedules for their class.

Get all published exam timetables.

**Filters Applied:**
- Only published timetables (is_published = true)
- Only active (is_deleted = false)

**Access:**
Public - available to students, parents, and teachers

**Use Case:**
Public exam schedule board showing all published timetables.

Update an existing exam timetable.

**Optional Fields:**
- `exam_name`: Update exam name
- `start_date`: Update start date
- `end_date`: Update end date
- `subjects`: Update subject schedules (replaces entire array)
- `is_published`: Change publication status
- `meta_data`: Update metadata

**Note:**
- Cannot change exam_term_id
- Cannot change class_id (create new timetable instead)

**Validations:**
- All subjects must exist
- No schedule conflicts

Publish an exam timetable.

**Effect:**
- Sets is_published = true
- Timetable becomes visible to students and parents
- Appears in public endpoints

**Use Case:**
After creating and reviewing the timetable, publish it to make it visible to students.

Unpublish an exam timetable.

**Effect:**
- Sets is_published = false
- Timetable hidden from students and parents
- Removed from public endpoints

**Use Case:**
Hide timetable to make corrections or changes before republishing.

Soft delete an exam timetable.

**Behavior:**
- Sets is_deleted = true
- Sets is_active = false
- Timetable won't appear in GET requests
- Data preserved for audit purposes

**Use Case:**
Remove timetable that was created incorrectly or is no longer needed.

Check for schedule conflicts before creating or updating a timetable.

**Request Fields:**
- `exam_date`: Date to check
- `start_time`: Start time (HH:MM format)
- `end_time`: End time (HH:MM format)
- `exclude_id`: Timetable ID to exclude (optional, for updates)

**Response:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "has_conflicts": false,
    "conflicts": []
  },
  "message": "No schedule conflicts"
}
```

Or if conflicts found:
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "has_conflicts": true,
    "conflicts": [
      {
        "timetable_id": "tt123",
        "exam_name": "Final Term 2025",
        "subject_name": "Physics",
        "conflicting_time": "09:00 - 11:00"
      }
    ]
  },
  "message": "Schedule conflicts found"
}
```

**Use Case:**
Validate schedule before submitting timetable creation/update.

item.description: Exam timetable management endpoints. Each timetable is for a single class with scheduled subjects.

item.name: 3. Complete Workflow Example

request.description:
**Workflow Step 1**

Create exam term with Classes 7A, 7B, and 7C.

Save the returned `id` for next steps.

**Workflow Step 2**

Fetch term details to see the list of classes:
- Class 7A
- Class 7B  
- Class 7C

UI displays these as separate cards.

**Workflow Step 3a**

Create timetable specifically for Class 7A with:
- Mathematics on 15 May
- Physics on 17 May
- Computer Science on 19 May

**Workflow Step 3b**

Create separate timetable for Class 7B.

Note: Different dates and times than Class 7A!

**Workflow Step 3c**

Create timetable for Class 7C.

Now all three classes have their individual timetables!

**Workflow Step 4**

View all timetables created for Mid Term 2025:
- Class 7A timetable
- Class 7B timetable
- Class 7C timetable

Each shown as a separate card in the UI.

**Workflow Step 5**

Publish the timetable to make it visible to students and parents of Class 7A.

Repeat for Classes 7B and 7C.

item.description: Complete end-to-end workflow example showing how to create exam terms and individual timetables for multiple classes.
